resume.mission: I am a seasoned UX developer and designer. I live and die by user-centered application design and pragmatic coding practices. I have a soft spot for team building, mentoring, and UX/UI architecture. I am a bit of a mad scientist.
resume.quote: Developing people, process and products are my passion. I love working closer to the top of the stack. I've lead enterprise UI teams with a lean startup mentality. I've spent some time in the creative salt mines of an agency environment. I've had a couple years of leadership and UI architecture under my belt. I like what those things have done to my brain.
resume.skills: I know my way around UX design principles, information architecture, and front end performance tuning. Using tools like Angular, Wordpress, CraftCMS, Grunt, Powershell, Sublime text; I've designed and built everything from marketing & ecommerce sites to mobile apps that consume Restful Api's. Most of all, I like solving problems.

timeline.description: I collaborated within the design & development teams to implement new features, test plans and content for our custom ecommerce platform. I worked closely with marketing stakeholders to develop structure, architecture and design of a number of key marketing initiatives. I also helped standardize workflow, estimation and deploy processes, formalized and implemented brand guides, and mentored designers and developers. Using adobe creative suite plus tools like git, gulp, sass, and jquery I helped to make these projects not only brand focused, but functional and compelling.

I worked closely with the counder to establish brand identity and visual guidelines. I create art for all the bottles, packaging, glassware, as well as t-shirts and other merchandise sold at the brewery. I also handle all of the pre-press production work... I'm basically the entire art department for the whole organization.

I helped implement semantic, user-centered front end implementations for Petsmart, Radio Shack, GNC, Adidas, Ralph Lauren, and Timberland. I was involved in interviewing, mentoring and training new developers in web standards, modular CSS approaches and emerging browser technologies. I also led an internal tools and prototyping team utilizing a variety of technologies such as HTML5, CSS3, Responsive Web Design, LESS, Gruntjs, Angularjs, jQuery/UI, Jstl, CakePHP.

I provided my clients an array of services including project planning, visual and user experience design, and front end theme development for a variety of open source content management and ecommerce platforms (Drupal, Ubercart, CubeCart, Wordpress, and Textpattern).

I provided Webcore with a number of Web development and consulting services including visual design, and HTML, CSS, JavaScript based theme development for a variety of CMS platforms and even broader base of clients.
Focused largely on Wordpress theme development, I worked within a small team of cross discipline developers and designers to deliver dynamic web projects for a wide variety of clients and industries.
